summary: The Isle of Wight is an island and county in the English Channel, near Hampshire. It's England's largest island and has been a popular vacation spot since Victorian times. Known for its nice weather, beautiful coastline, and green fields, it's a UNESCO Biosphere Reserve. Famous people like poets Algernon Charles Swinburne and Alfred, Lord Tennyson, and Queen Victoria have lived there. The island has a rich history in boat-building and is known for its music festivals, including the huge Isle of Wight Festival in 1970. It's also important for its dinosaur fossils. Though it's now its own county, it was once part of Hampshire. Tourism is its biggest industry.
title: Isle of Wight
